It's pretty hard to find bike rims around here. I finally got a used one at the Highlander bike shop for $15, yippie! I also took off the handlebar ends that caused me to crash in the first place.

It didn't hurt much the day I crashed, but it sure hit me the next day. I had started to think I had broken a rib. I'm finally getting better and can move around again. Tomorrow I'll probably try to find a new rim.

My bike's outward facing handlebars caught the fence at Willow Canyon and I was thrown off the bike today. My front rim is totally bent. I landed a few feet away on my knees, elbows, and the top joints of my pinkies. Yesterday Rahula (my cat) carried home a baby duck that got seperated from it's mother. He didn't hurt it at all, he carried it like a kitten. We found the flock wandering the neighborhood and reunited the duck with it's mom. I wish I would have thought to take a picture of the duck, but I didn't.
